metadata.title: CVE-2017-7443 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
apt-cacher before 1.7.15 and apt-cacher-ng before 3.4 allow HTTP response splitting via encoded newline characters, related to lack of blocking for the %0[ad] regular expression.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-7443` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apt-cacher - 1.7.15
No subscription required

apt-cacher-ng - 3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apt-cacher package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.7.15').
apt-cacher-ng package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3-1').
